caption:
This photograph captures a middle-aged man engaged in operating a large, circular valve mechanism. He is outside, under a clear blue sky, possibly working on a water irrigation system or similar infrastructure.

The man is dressed in work attire, consisting of a light blue denim shirt, dark blue jeans, and sturdy work boots. He is also wearing a green hard hat. He appears focused on his task, looking down as he manipulates the valve, which is connected to a vertical metal rod.

The setting includes a concrete structure partially filled with water, which could be a component of a canal or storage basin. This suggests the location is utilitarian, possibly related to agricultural or industrial water management. In the background, the landscape is flat and open, hinting at a rural or undeveloped location. The overall composition of the image emphasizes the man's engagement with his physical task, set against the broader context of the infrastructure he is interacting with.
title: Vincent Humeumptewa, Hopi Indian and employee of the irrigation district, opens canal gates near Parker.
